title: Full Stack Software Engineer (C#/Angular)
description:
G-Research is Europe's leading quantitative finance research firm. We hire the brightest minds in the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in finance. We pair this expertise with machine learning, big data, and some of the most advanced technology available to predict movements in financial markets.

Software Engineering is core to our business. By designing and implementing real-time systems, our engineers are solving some of the world's most complex financial problems.

The role

The Trading Platform Services Engineering group at G-Research consists of more than a dozen Software Engineers, and we are seeking additional engineers to join us. We are a customer-centric Engineering team working closely with our clients, with a strong focus on UX. Many of our projects involve working with other Engineering teams, making this an excellent opportunity to gain a good understanding of the business and trading platform.

We are building cutting-edge systems to allow our clients to monitor and manage a complex platform in realtime. This includes platform configuration and release management for tens of thousands of trading services, and realtime processing of data streamed from systems all over the world. We leverage the latest technologies such as Kafka and Kubernetes to address the huge scale of the problems we are solving.

Our engineers are encouraged to take ownership of projects and deliver the best results using whichever technologies and methodologies they and the team see fit.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Working in an agile, self-organising environment to develop full-stack web applications, with an emphasis on software engineering principles, effective UX, and polished UI design
  • Integrating with trading platform components via a variety of mechanisms, e.g. REST APIs, Kafka
  • Liaising directly with customers to scope out, design and iterate on solutions

Who are we looking for?

The ideal candidate will be an intelligent, passionate and creative software engineer with a proven ability to develop and deliver high-quality software. They will have:

  • Excellent OO programming skills, ideally in C# (or Java)
  • Experience with a frontend technology, e.g. Angular
  • A proven track record of full-stack engineering
  • Excellent communication skills
  • A self-starting attitude

Advantageous experience and skills include:

  • Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks and PWAs
  • Understanding of CI/CD principles and implementation, e.g. Jenkins
  • Exposure to an agile and collaborative team environment
  • Experience with containers and cloud-native technologies, e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, .NET Core
  • Experience with messaging middlewares and stream processing technologies, e.g. Kafka

Why should you apply?

  • Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus
  • Informal dress code and excellent work/life balance
  • Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
  • 25 days holiday
  • 9% company pension contributions
  • Cycle-to-work scheme
  • Subsidised gym membership
  • Monthly company events
  • Central London office close to 5 stations and 6 tube lines

title: Full Stack Developer / WooCommerce Wizard
description:
whynow is a new arts and culture digital platform promoting personal, powerful and positive stories in the capital and beyond.

As a subscription platform, members of whynow get access to a growing range of videos, articles, podcasts and more. We are looking for a woocommerce wizard who will work with us and be responsible for the maintenance and growth of both our frontend checkout system, built in React and the accompanying custom woocommerce extensions written in PHP running on our headless CMS.

This position requires full stack programming skills in the following technologies: (Woocommerce, React, PHP, SQL, writing tests). The candidate should have a strong understanding of woocommerce and wordpress as a content management system. Although this is a focused position the ideal candidate should have a good grasp on the entire web development process from UX design through to development, testing and deployment. The candidate would need to have the ability to follow and track issues, write code and test changes on both the frontend and backend of our checkout system.

As we are a young company in constant evolution our long term goal for this role would also be to facilitate moving away from the dependency on woocommerce at scale. This would involve consultancy on the alternative e-commerce packages available and working on the migration itself which would involve some nifty script writing and SQL query abilities. Responsibilities Developing and optimising the overall frontend checkout process Developing and maintaining the backend of the checkout Monitoring woocommerce version updates and addressing breaking changes Build on and develop and test our coupon and promotional systems Write tests for edge cases to catch potential bugs on checkout Troubleshooting customer subscription reporting that feeds into google analytics and hubspot Consulting and research on viable ecommerce platform alternatives Facilitating potential migration to another CMS and ecommerce platform at scale Working on the development of new ecommerce features such as a store

Skills Required Complete understanding of web development basics: HTML5 CSS3 JavaScript Strong understanding of the woocommerce platform and some experience developing in this environment Solid understanding of development in the following web technologies relevant to our stack: React PHP SQL Experience developing fully responsive ecommerce websites and applications Comfortable working with chrome inspector debugging tools Knowledge of headless cms architecture and how to interact with RESTful APIs and data in JSON format Proficient working knowledge of git version control Strong understanding of PHP development and wordpress

PLEASE NOTE:

  1. This is a programming job. You MUST have 4+ years experience in web and software development technology.
  2. You MUST have experience in woocommerce or have completed some online training in this platform to be considered for this role.
  3. You MUST be in London and able to come into the office and work on location.
  4. You MUST be fluent in English.

Salary competitive Holiday standard
how_to_apply: Please email your CV and a cover letter to me at connor@whynow.co.uk

title: Director of IT & Enterprise Applications
description:
Job overview

The Director of IT and Enterprise applications will be responsible for the overall IT, Informatics & Enterprise Application strategy for COMPASS Pathways to drive operational excellence. This individual will work closely with the Leadership team, system & business process owners, our third-party vendors and the rest of the organization to evaluate, deploy and integrate new and current systems and services. The Director of IT & Enterprise applications will be responsible for ensuring best-in-class data and infrastructure security protocols and work closely with other departments to ensure compliance with GDPR and other relevant regulatory policies such as GxP and CCPA.

COMPASS Pathways is a mental health care company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health (https://compasspathways.com). Our focus is on improving the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments. We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin therapy, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin, COMP360, is administered in conjunction with psychological support.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Lead the IT, Informatics & Enterprise Applications efforts companywide for COMPASS while building the strategy and long-term vision for the technology infrastructure for the company
  • Help lead the technical GDPR, DPIA assessments, & other data privacy efforts
  • Develop and own the enterprise IT application stack while managing associated budgets and supports
  • Work closely with Finance, Legal & other operational groups to deploy necessary infrastructure for ongoing operations
  • Liaise with the clinical and pre-clinical organizations to help develop the data storage and analysis infrastructure
  • Work closely with Digital Health Research Team and Data Engineering for the rapid deployment of custom AI & Machine learning applications
  • Test and evaluate business applications using industry-wide best practices to ensure quality, flexibility, and security
  • Work with 3rd party providers to do appropriate penetration testing and other appropriate audits of computer systems
  • Work with all parties to ensure compliance with Sarbanes Oxley IT General Controls (ITGC)
  • Oversee large and small IT projects to completion while supervising staff, consultants, contractors and other resources
  • Create, drive, and deliver appropriate training materials, associated internal policies, and presentations regarding company IT policies and best practices

Detailed responsibilities/accountabilities

  • The position reports into SVP, Data Science, Machine Learning and Digital Health Research.

Profile

  • Significant prior experience leading the IT function at other companies with a strong data focus. Regulated digital health care start-up and/or Life Science companies are strongly preferred.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field. Master’s degree preferred.
  • Strong hands-on experience of modern enterprise cloud platforms and technologies (AWS & Azure experience required).
  • Good understanding of CI/CD, Atlassian, Github and other common SAAS platforms used for development. Familiarity with JIRA/Agile and other development environments.
  • Significant experience with eQMS, QC CRM, Document Management systems and other common life science / SaMD technical infrastructure.
  • Experience with 21 CFR 11, GxP document control systems and Sarbanes Oxley IT General Controls (ITGC) a very strong plus, along with knowledge of FDA/EMA compliance principles.
  • Good grasp of pharmaceutical R&D model, including regulatory and market access pathways, processes and requirements.
  • Demonstrable experience of Information Technology compliance programs and industry leading practices/frameworks including ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, and cloud principles.
  • Strong analytical, project management, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to operate independently and in cross-functional teams under uncertainty in an entrepreneurial and rapid growth-oriented environment.
  • Strong alignment with core company mission and values.
  • Flexibility to work remotely from UK or US.

How to apply

If interested, please send your CV and statement of interest to hiring@compasspathways.com

Note that we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, and therefore can only accept applications from people who have employment rights in the US or UK.

Equal opportunities

US applicants

COMPASS Pathways is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), ethnicity, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military service, genetic information, familial or marital status, or any other status, category, or characteristic protected by applicable law.

UK applicants

We are proud of our commitment to diversity and equality (pursuant to the Equality Act 2010). We do not discriminate based upon race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, age or disability.

title: Machine Learning Scientist
description:
Job overview

The Machine Learning Scientist will support a diverse set of initiatives to improve patient selection, treatment and follow-up via the development of novel machine learning & AI algorithms. You will partner with internal and external stakeholders to develop insights and models to advance discoveries in mental health care.

COMPASS Pathways is a mental health care company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health (https://compasspathways.com). Our focus is on improving the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments. We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin therapy, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin, COMP360, is administered in conjunction with psychological support.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Provide expertise company-wide on a variety of Machine Learning and AI topics in order to improve the patient journey and provide mission-critical applications as COMPASS grows
  • Develop algorithms & methodologies that incorporate digital and traditional biomarkers (voice, vision, smart device, etc.) in order to improve the treatment process
  • Work collaboratively with engineering (back-end/front-end/UI+UX/ and others) to deploy these algorithms in a highly scalable and distributed infrastructure to help patients in real time
  • Communicate insights with stakeholders with the ability to extract therapeutic intelligence by leveraging external and internal data sources
  • Work closely with stakeholders to identify quantitative and technological needs for various COMPASS projects

Detailed responsibilities/accountabilities

  • The position reports to the VP of Digital Health Research

Profile

  • Substantial experience in the field either through industry and/or academia. Biotech & start-up experience a strong plus (Degree in: Statistics, Computer Science, Neuroscience, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related)
  • Strong analytical, project management, written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient in Python (scikit-learn, numpy, pandas, matplotlib, scipy) and experience with Tensorflow/Keras and/or Pytorch
  • Deep experience with at least one of the following: Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, time-series signal processing, audio signal processing.
  • Understanding of at least 2-3 common machine learning & AI architectures (convolutional neural nets, reinforcement learning, attention & transformer-based networks, graph neural nets, generative adversarial networks, etc.)
  • Comfortable with Linux and the AWS cloud environment
  • Ability to operate independently and in cross-functional teams in an entrepreneurial and rapid growth-oriented environment
  • Strong alignment with core company mission and values; Compassionate, Bold, Rigorous, and Inclusive
  • Ability to work in the UK or US

Additional qualifications - preferred

  • A PhD in a computational field (Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Neuroscience, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related)
  • Industry experience in a machine learning or AI role within a digital health organisation, pharma, or biotech
  • Experience in R (tidyr, dplyr, ggplot2, Rstudio)
  • Background in EEG, fMRI, and other brain measurement technologies a strong plus
  • Familiar with R Shiny and/or other app development technologies such as Django/Angular/Clojure

How to apply

If interested, please send your CV and statement of interest to hiring@compasspathways.com

Note that we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, and therefore can only accept applications from people who have employment rights in the US or UK.

Equal opportunities

US applicants

COMPASS Pathways is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), ethnicity, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military service, genetic information, familial or marital status, or any other status, category, or characteristic protected by applicable law.

We are proud of our commitment to diversity and equality (pursuant to the Equality Act 2010). We do not discriminate based upon race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, age or disability.

title: Software Engineering and IT Project Manager
description:
Job overview

The Software Engineering and IT Project Manager will support a diverse set of initiatives to improve patient selection, treatment and follow-up by coordinating and driving the various AI & machine learning development efforts under way at COMPASS.

COMPASS Pathways is a mental health care company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health (https://compasspathways.com). Our focus is on improving the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments. We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin therapy, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin, COMP360, is administered in conjunction with psychological support.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Manage and facilitate the overall project management process from inception to design to implementation and value follow up
  • Work closely with the product manager to ensure each project is integrated into the broader strategic vision of COMPASS and help define metrics of project success
  • Facilitate the creation and adherence to project plans and timelines (both for internal and external stakeholders) by:
  • Enabling discussions to generate requirements, cross-functional interdependencies, and required resources which lead to measurable KPIs and OKRs
  • Organizing projects into distinct, measurable objectives and activities and bringing together the correct stakeholders to execute on agreed upon objectives
  • Manage and coordinate tasks, schedules, issues, risks and status to ensure timely delivery of ongoing development work
  • Maintain a regular reporting cadence both within the project team as well as to management and additional stake holders in terms of project/program scope, time, resourcing and costs to ensure changes are appropriate and agreed upon
  • Monitor and apply appropriate governance policies to projects and data
  • Work very closely with data and machine learning scientists, engineering (back-end/front-end/ data/UI+UX/ and others) and IT to successfully deliver on ongoing project
  • Enable transparency in terms of deliverables to all internal and external stakeholders
  • Work closely with stakeholders to identify quantitative and technological needs for various COMPASS projects
  • Write various project documentations to inform and update internal and external stakeholders

Detailed responsibilities/accountabilities

  • Supporting Data Science, Engineering and IT teams

Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT, Engineering or other relevant academic discipline
  • Project management experience
  • Experience with Scrum/Agile/Kanban/Waterfall project management methods
  • Leadership and executive presence combined with fantastic interpersonal skills and relationship management skills
  • Ability to influence direction and processes without direct authority
  • Strong oral, written and analytical abilities
  • Strong alignment with core company mission and values Compassionate, Bold, Rigorous, and Inclusive
  • Ability to work in the UK or US

Additional qualifications - preferred

  • Advanced degree (Master’s/MBA) in relevant academic discipline
  • Familiarity with AI & Machine learning algorithms a strong plus
  • Experience in the Biotech and/or Health tech fields a strong plus

How to apply

If interested, please send your CV and statement of interest to hiring@compasspathways.com

Note that we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, and therefore can only accept applications from people who have employment rights in the US or UK.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Job overview

The Data Scientist will support a diverse set of initiatives including statistical computational modelling, advanced analytics and AI projects. You will partner with internal and external stakeholders to develop insights and models to advance discoveries in mental health care.

COMPASS Pathways is a mental health care company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health (https://compasspathways.com). Our focus is on improving the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments. We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin therapy, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin, COMP360, is administered in conjunction with psychological support.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Provide expertise company-wide ranging from data science & analytics to more traditional statistical and computer science analysis in order to improve the patient journey and provide mission-critical applications as COMPASS grows
  • Develop algorithms & analyses that incorporate digital and traditional biomarkers (voice, vision, smart device, EEG, others) in order to improve the treatment process via more accurate intervention, personalized therapeutics or real time post-treatment follow up
  • Work collaboratively with engineering (back-end/front-end/UI+UX/ and others) to deploy these algorithms in a highly scalable and distributed infrastructure to help patients in real time
  • Communicate insights with stakeholders with the ability to extract therapeutic intelligence by leveraging external and internal data sources
  • Work closely with stakeholders to identify quantitative and technological needs for various COMPASS projects

Detailed responsibilities/accountabilities

  • The position reports into the VP of Digital Health Research

Profile

  • Substantial experience in the field either through industry and/or academia. Biotech & start-up experience a strong plus (Degree in: Statistics, Computer Science, Neuroscience, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related)
  • Strong analytical, project management, written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient in at least one of Python (scikit-learn, numpy, pandas, matplotlib) or R (tidyr, dplyr, ggplot2, Rstudio)
  • Understanding of a variety of statistical and/or machine learning methods (regression, statistical hypothesis testing and design of experiments, tree-based algorithms, supervised vs unsupervised learning). Expert knowledge in a selection of several key areas
  • Comfortable with Linux and the AWS cloud environment
  • Ability to operate independently and in cross-functional teams in an entrepreneurial and rapid growth-oriented environment
  • Strong alignment with core company mission and values Compassionate, Bold, Rigorous, and Inclusive
  • Ability to work in the UK or US

Additional qualifications - preferred

  • A PhD in a computational field (Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Neuroscience, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related)
  • Industry experience as a data scientist in a digital health organisation, pharma, or biotech
  • Background in EEG, fMRI, and other brain measurement technologies a strong plus
  • Experience with Tensorflow/Keras and/or Pytorch. Previous background in NLP and/or computer vision a strong plus
  • Experience in modern front-end development and data visualisation
  • Familiar with R Shiny and/or other modern front-end development and data visualization technologies

How to apply

If interested, please send your CV and statement of interest to hiring@compasspathways.com

Note that we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, and therefore can only accept applications from people who have employment rights in the US or UK.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Job overview

The Full Stack Software Engineer will be responsible for delivering COMPASS’s online learning platform. The interactive platform will be used to provide theoretical and practice-based training to psychological therapists and. We want to develop a world class data-driven platform that supports and enables therapists to be the best they can be so that we are well placed to transform mental health care. Emphasis is on user experience and security, while maintaining the best practices.

COMPASS Pathways is a mental health care company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health (https://compasspathways.com). Our focus is on improving the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments. We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin therapy, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin, COMP360, is administered in conjunction with psychological support.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Own the technical part of the learning management platform, both frontend and backend
  • Ensure the system is scalable, secure and robust
  • Actively contribute to product iteration and development to ensure product is delivering an excellent experience to users
  • Hire, train, mentor and grow fellow engineers
  • Write and ship high quality, best-practice grade code, ensure technical documentation is up to date
  • Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency
  • Work across functional teams in the company to translate requirements into technical features, and with data scientists and analysts to develop software.

Detailed responsibilities/accountabilities

  • The position reports into the Head of Engineering
  • The position works closely with the Therapy Research and Training Team, UI/UX designer, data scientists, and learning designer

Profile

  • Experience in product software development (both front-end and back-end) Ideally have worked on a Learning Management System or within the education sector
  • Language agnosticism, understanding of strengths and weaknesses of various languages, systems and frameworks
  • Expert knowledge of React or Angular ecosystem. Experience with Typescript and Next.js are a plus
  • Expertise in Python and experience with other programming languages, ideally Java
  • Good understanding of how relational DBMS (ideally Postgres) work, proficiency in SQL and query performance tuning
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-code frameworks (e.g., Terraform) is a plus
  • Strong analytical, project management, written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to operate independently and in cross-functional teams under uncertainty in an entrepreneurial and rapid growth-oriented environment
  • Strong alignment with core company mission and values
  • Ability to work in the UK or US (London or New York offices)

How to apply

If interested, please send your CV and statement of interest to hiring@compasspathways.com

Note that we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, and therefore can only accept applications from people who have employment rights in the US or UK.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Job overview

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer, who will be owning COMPASS’s cloud, AWS-based infrastructure. It is mostly used by our data scientists, researchers and software engineers developing internal products. We would like to create a secure and scalable (both in terms of users and volumes) place which will protect the privacy of our patients while still allowing space for creativity and experimentation.

COMPASS Pathways is a mental health care company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health (https://compasspathways.com). Our focus is on improving the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments. We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin therapy, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin, COMP360, is administered in conjunction with psychological support.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Own our AWS cloud infrastructure and ensure the system is scalable, robust and purpose fit
  • Introduce and adopt the best practices related to the infrastructure-as-code, continuous delivery and integration in the cloud
  • Automate and improve development and release processes
  • Ensure that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
  • Act as the infrastructure domain expert and evangelist
  • Troubleshoot various issues related to networking and load
  • Configure, troubleshoot and optimize the performance of database systems
  • Assist in project management decisions

Detailed responsibilities/accountabilities

  • The position reports into the Head of Engineering
  • The position works closely with the rest of the engineering department (UI/UX, Full Stack, etc) as well as the data science and IT groups
  • The person will also liaison cross-functionally as necessary to support infrastructure company-wide

Profile

  • Experience in DevOps, development, systems administration
  • Knowledge of python required. Familiarity with Java and other programming languages is a strong plus.
  • Experience with container systems such as Docker, Kubernetes.
  • Expert knowledge of AWS ecosystem and common Linux platforms (amazon-emi, centOS, others).
  • Experience building AWS infrastructure from the ground up in a fast start-up environment.
  • Familiarity with GDPR, CCPA and other security regulations.
  • Good understanding of how relational DBMS (ideally Postgres) work under the hood, proficiency query performance tuning
  • Experience with configuration management and orchestration tools (Terraform, Ansible, Cloudformation)
  • Strong analytical, project management, written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to operate independently and in cross-functional teams under uncertainty in an entrepreneurial and rapid growth-oriented environment
  • Strong alignment with core company mission and values
  • Ability to work in the UK or US (London or New York offices)

How to apply

If interested, please send your CV and statement of interest to hiring@compasspathways.com

Note that we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, and therefore can only accept applications from people who have employment rights in the US or UK.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Job overview

The UI/UX Designer will be responsible for shaping and developing the user experience and interface for an online training platform. for therapists. The platform will be used to provide theoretical and practice-based training to psychological therapists. We want to develop a world class platform that supports and enables therapist to be the best they can be so that we are well placed to transform mental health care.

COMPASS Pathways is a mental health care company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health (https://compasspathways.com). Our focus is on improving the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments. We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin therapy, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin, COMP360, is administered in conjunction with psychological support.

Roles and responsibilities

  • Partner with the therapy research and training team, eLearning Designer and Developer, engineers and product manager to design an elegant and easy-to-use learning management system
  • Take broad and conceptual ideas and turn them into prototypes and features for our therapists
  • Develop design flows and experiences that are incredibly simple and elegant for both web and mobile platforms
  • Contribute to the overall creative strategy and vision (both “what should we build” and “how it should look”)
  • Take broad and conceptual ideas and turn them into prototypes and features for our therapists
  • Conduct user research and interviews, and share insights with various stakeholders and integrate into design decisions through insight decks, user journeys, personas, design principles and strategic roadmaps and product features

Detailed responsibilities/accountabilities

  • The position reports into the Product Manager
  • Key internal partners include; Therapy Research and Training team

Profile

  • Experience in designing, building and shipping quality mobile and web platforms in the online education and/or healthcare space
  • Highly creative, empathetic and detail oriented - please attach an online portfolio to the application
  • Experience in interaction and visual design and prototyping
  • Highly skilled in Adobe XD/Figma/Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, and other design tools
  • Demonstrate ability to prototype in HTML/CSS/JavaScript, AfterEffects, or other tools
  • Demonstrate communications skills while articulating design decisions
  • Experience running user interviews and testing various prototypes with users
  • Strong analytical, project management, written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to operate independently and in cross-functional teams under uncertainty in an entrepreneurial and rapid growth-oriented environment
  • Strong alignment with core company mission and values
  • Ability to work in the UK or US (London or New York offices)

How to apply

If interested, please send your CV and statement of interest to hiring@compasspathways.com

Note that we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, and therefore can only accept applications from people who have employment rights in the US or UK.

Equal opportunities

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
At Quantcast, data is king, and we know how to process it. The unique features of our custom map/reduce implementation include a revolutionary petabyte sort mechanism; an efficient and flexible petabyte join and lookup, based on innovative data indexing and partitioning mechanisms; dynamic task size adjustment in running jobs; and a self-tuning system that learns and improves job performance without developer intervention. In the last 5 years, it has allowed Quantcast to scale from processing 400 to 40,000 terabytes of data per day. For the typical ETL, analytics, and machine learning work at Quantcast, our big data processing platform is on average 4 to 5 times more efficient than the popular open source solutions.

Quantcast is looking for Senior Engineers to help build the next generation big data and real time processing platform. From integrating and improving new open source technologies, to inventing your own, there are many opportunities to have a tremendous impact.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop high performance distributed computing systems
  • Diagnose and produce system solutions to big data problems
  • Perform design, architecture, and code reviews
  • Mentor and grow more junior team members, Innovate in the big data space: lead, not follow
  • Provide technical input into product roadmaps for the team

Requirements:

  • BS Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • 3 years of industry experience in software development
  • Experience working on large-scale distributed systems
  • Experience optimizing the performance of large-scale distributed systems
  • Deep understanding of distributed systems
  • Proficient in Java and/or C++
  • Strong software development skills (version control, code review, testing, release, monitoring, debugging)
  • Proficiency and high level of insight into Linux OS and running software systems on Linux

Quantcast is an audience intelligence and measurement company headquartered in San Francisco. Combining machine learning, a privacy-by-design approach, and live data drawn from more than 100 million online destinations, Quantcast provides software, information and advertising services for marketers, publishers and advertising agencies worldwide. Founded in 2006, Quantcast has employees in 20 offices across 10 countries.

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone can be their authentic self. We work to ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
Job Title: Senior User Interface Developer

Salary: Competitive

Based:  BrandAlley, Telephone House, 69-77 Paul Street, London, EC2A 4NW (remote during Covid-19

Experience: Expert User Interface Developer / Magento 1 & 2 Developer

Reporting to: CTO

Who We Are

Brand Alley UK Limited is the UK’s largest online flash sale fashion retailer and is currently going through a period of exponential growth. With upwards of 5 million members, we sell top branded fashion and homeware products, process tens of thousands of orders per day and we are one of the most successful E-Commerce brands in the UK.

Operating between London and Delhi, our team of developers and Magento specialists work on a wide range of projects for the BrandAlley Web platform. Its dynamic, diverse and an incredibly exciting time as BrandAlley migrates its front-end web platform into Magento 2 and moves its entire back office team into a custom built platform consisting of a PIM, warehousing, merchandising, customer service, and marketing modules. With this new architecture in place 2021 will see a backlog of new features developed for www.brandalley.co.uk and our European site (www.brandalley.fr) built and migrated onto its own Magento 2 instance and connected into the same back office systems as the UK site.

Along with the launch of our IOS and Android Apps, 2021 can also see the further break-up of the Magento user interface layer into rich Progressive Web Apps making this a truly exciting opportunity.

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced User Interface Developer with proven experience of working with large scale web applications to join our team. This role will be perfect for an individual who has been developing Magento User Interfaces for a number of years, has a heightened passion for making Magento work beyond its limits, creating high performance JavaScript, CSS and HTML and either is working with PWA technology right now or has at least begun the journey and is investing time in learning the technology.

﻿Duties and Responsibilities

● To develop and progress the website user interface & optimise applications for maximum speed and scalability.

● Work in an Agile environment to develop the latest and greatest code for web and layout guidance for our Mobile App.

● Code user interface changes to existing features and prototyping and building new features.

● Testing the existing website to ensure that it continually meets internal customer’s expectations.

● Ensure high end user stability and performance using manual and automation testing techniques

● Ensure the technical feasibility of user interface designs and control good quality ux output in line with the overall web and mobile strategy

● Promote and drive best practice

● Stay abreast of latest user interface technology trends

● Provide resource quotations to product owners & business analysts

● Provide accurate information into JIRA

Skills and Experience Required

● Strong Magento frontend development experience (Magento 1 & 2)

● Strong experience of developing applications using HTML5 / jQuery / Knockout and RequireJs

● Strong experience with CSS3, CSS pre-processors and the differing methodologies (preferred LESS)

● Strong experience of JavaScript

● Strong experience asynchronous control flow, partial page updates, ajax, private Magento content techniques, data layer (Google)

● Strong experience debugging browser behavior & performance issues,

● Can create and operate local development environment using Docker

● Strong Git, GitFlow and Composer skills

● Strong team player

To Stand Out

● Someone who has skills with Progressive Web App (PWA) development

● Someone who is a JavaScript genius and JavaScript has become your life

● Someone who develops with a “performance first” mindset

● Someone who can mentor and guide more junior developers

● Someone who loves to learn new technology

● Someone who can talk tech and none tech when neededz

Eligibility

● You must be eligible to live and work in the UK

● You must be able to work onsite in London (Old Street)

The Candidate

Self-motivated, adaptable with a positive attitude Enthusiastic and respectful of others Must have a ‘Can do approach’ Flexible and willing to go the extra mile with a good sense of humour Must be able to work autonomously

Why You’ll Like Working with Us

You’ll have the opportunity to work on some exciting brands supported by an inspiring and friendly team of people You’ll join a great talented team who are all driven to be the best they can be, while having a lot of fun along the way We offer a place to grow, where you can spread your wings
how_to_apply: Email your CV and Cover Letter to: andrew.miles@brandalley.co.uk

title: Lead Developer (magento)
description:
About the job Job Title: Lead Developer (magento)

Salary: Competitive

Based:  BrandAlley, Telephone House, 69-77 Paul Street, London, EC2A 4NW (remote during Covid-19)

Experience: Expert Engineer / Magento 1 & 2 Developer / Team Lead

Reporting to: CTO

Who We Are?

Brand Alley UK Limited is the UK’s largest online flash sale fashion retailer and is currently going through a period of exponential growth. With upwards of 5 million members, we sell top branded fashion and homeware products, process tens of thousands of orders per day and we are one of the most successful E-Commerce brands in the UK.

Operating between London and Delhi, our team of developers and Magento specialists work on a wide range of projects for the BrandAlley Web platform. Its dynamic, diverse and an incredibly exciting time as BrandAlley migrates its front-end web platform into Magento 2 and moves its entire back office team into a custom-built platform consisting of a PIM, warehousing, merchandising, customer service, and marketing tools. With this new architecture in place 2021 will see a backlog of new features developed for www.brandalley.co.uk and our European site (www.brandalley.fr) built and migrated onto its own Magento 2 instance and connected into the same back office systems as the UK site.

Along with the launch of our IOS and Android Apps, 2021 will also see the further break-up of the Magento user interface layer into rich Progressive Web Apps making this a truly exciting opportunity.

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced Team Lead with proven experience of working with large scale web applications to join our team in London. This role will be perfect for an individual who has been developing on Magento, PHP and MySQL and running Apps in AWS for a number of years, has a heightened passion for making Magento work beyond its limits and has lead teams that create high performance code and stacks on container environments.

Duties and Responsibilities

● Determining project requirements and developing work schedules for the team along with product owners and analysts.

● Delegating tasks and achieving daily, weekly, and monthly goals.

● Liaising with team members, management, and internal clients to ensure projects are completed to standard.

● Identifying risks and forming contingency plans as soon as possible.

● Constantly maintain a secure environment and evaluate security posture.

● Analysis existing system operations and scheduling training sessions and meetings to discuss improvements.

● Provide resource quotations to product owners & business analysts.

● Performing troubleshooting as required.

● Being transparent with the team about challenges, failures, and successes.

● Ensure that all systems and platforms are supported and adequately manned at all times.

● Ensure high end user stability and performance of systems.

● Writing progress reports and delivering presentations to the relevant stakeholders.

● Promote and drive best practice.

● Provide accurate information into JIRA.

● Keeping up to date with industry trends and developments.

● Updating work schedules in JIRA.

Skills and Experience Required

● Strong Magento development background experience (Magento 1 & 2).

● Strong Magento troubleshooting experience.

● Strong database skills in MySQL, Performance Schema, MySQL Tuning, Monitoring, and troubleshooting.

● Strong experience debugging performance issues.

● Strong DevOps, AWS, and Server experience.

● Strong Docker, Kubernetes, Container and Terraform experience.

● Strong Security focus.

● Strong Git and Composer experience.

● Strong team player.

To Stand Out

● Someone who has skills and experience managing Progressive Web App (PWA) development.

● Someone who develops with a “performance first” mindset.

● Someone who can mentor and guide developers.

● Someone who loves to learn new technology.

● Someone who can talk tech and non tech when needed.

Eligibility

● You must be eligible to live and work in the UK.

● You must be able to work onsite in London (Old Street).

The Candidate

· Self-motivated, adaptable with a positive attitude

· Enthusiastic and respectful of others

· Must have a ‘Can do approach’

· Flexible and willing to go the extra mile with a good sense of humour

· Must be able to work autonomously

Why You’ll Like Working with Us

· You’ll have the opportunity to work on some exciting brands supported by an inspiring and friendly team of people

· You’ll join a great talented team who are all driven to be the best they can be, while having a lot of fun along the way

· We offer a place to grow, where you can spread your wings
how_to_apply: Email your CV and Cover Letter to andrew.miles@brandalley.co.uk
